page.title: 14Pastimes around Hordley
page.content: People have to travel at least as far as Ellesmere to join formal societies. People in our area belong to a variety of clubs ranging from drama to the motor club. Frankton and Ellesmere have branches of both W.I. and Mothers Union but it is difficult for ladies to get to these traditional rural pastimes. Gardening is popular, with most houses sporting attractive flower gardens and having large vegetable patches. Indoor activities range from Open University to commercial knitting where one lady spins her own wool using a spinning wheel. A local artist paints landscapes and boats while a lady paints decorated eggs. Outdoors, the canal is popular for fishing with youngsters,and some farmers are keen shots. Pigeon fancying is found in the area while more energetic play squash at nearby Ellesmere College.
